definitions: prescribed form or set of forms for public religious worship
collection of formularies used in religious services and ceremonies
examples: The Orthodox liturgy includes elaborate chanting and incense rituals
Their wedding followed the traditional Anglican liturgy precisely
The priest studied ancient liturgies from medieval manuscripts
Eastern liturgies differ significantly from Western Christian traditions

definitions: means of securing the necessities of life through work or income
examples: Fishing provides the primary livelihood for coastal communities
The drought threatened farmers' livelihoods throughout the region

definitions: large glandular organ that processes nutrients and filters blood
organ meat consumed as food from various animals
examples: The liver produces bile essential for digesting fats
Alcohol consumption can severely damage your liver over time
She ordered chicken liver pâté as an appetizer
Beef liver contains high amounts of iron and vitamins

definitions: special uniform worn by servants or officials of a household
business of keeping horses and vehicles for hire
distinctive color scheme or design on vehicles identifying ownership
examples: The chauffeur wore formal livery with gold buttons
Palace servants dressed in royal livery for ceremonies
The livery stable rented horses and carriages daily
They boarded their horses at the local livery
The taxi displayed the company's distinctive yellow livery
Racing cars sport their team's livery during competitions

definitions: farm animals regarded as an asset or raised for commercial purposes
examples: The ranch raises livestock including cattle and sheep
Livestock farming requires substantial investment in feed and facilities

definitions: means of earning money to support oneself financially
particular manner or style of daily life and activities
people who are currently alive as distinguished from the dead
examples: She makes a comfortable living as a freelance writer
Many artists struggle to earn a living from their work
Simple living appeals to those seeking less materialistic lifestyles
Their standard of living improved after the promotion
The memorial honors both the living and the dead
He is considered the greatest living composer today

definitions: reptile with four legs, a long tail, and scaly skin
examples: The gecko lizard climbed effortlessly up the wall
Desert lizards regulate temperature by basking on rocks

definitions: domesticated South American camelid used as pack animal and for wool
examples: Llamas carry supplies for trekkers in the Andes mountains
The llama's soft wool makes excellent warm clothing

definitions: weight or quantity that is being carried or supported
amount of goods or passengers conveyed by a vehicle
amount of work or responsibility assigned to someone
electrical power delivered by a generator or required by a circuit
examples: The truck carried a heavy load of construction materials
Workers distributed the load evenly across the platform
The ship transported its full load of containers
Each delivery truck handles multiple loads daily
Her teaching load includes five classes this semester
The project load was distributed among team members
The generator couldn't handle the electrical load during peak hours
Circuit breakers protect against excessive electrical loads

definitions: machine designed to load materials onto vehicles or into containers
person whose job involves loading goods or materials
program component that loads data or other programs into memory
examples: The front-end loader moved gravel into the dump truck
Construction sites use wheel loaders for earthmoving tasks
Dock loaders stacked containers onto the cargo ship
The loader organized packages by delivery route
The boot loader initializes the operating system at startup
The image loader processes graphics files for display

definitions: process of putting goods or materials onto a vehicle or into storage
additional charge or weight factor applied in calculations or pricing
examples: Loading of the cargo ship takes approximately six hours
Proper loading prevents damage during transportation
Insurance premiums include a loading for administrative costs
The loading factor accounts for structural safety margins

definitions: shaped mass of bread baked as a single unit
food shaped into an oblong form before cooking or serving
examples: She bought a fresh loaf of sourdough from the bakery
The loaf rose perfectly during baking
The meatloaf recipe calls for ground beef and breadcrumbs
They served salmon loaf with dill sauce

definitions: spending time in an idle or aimless manner without working
examples: The supervisor caught employees loafing in the break room
Summer vacation meant days of loafing by the pool

definitions: fertile soil composed of sand, silt, clay, and organic matter in balanced proportions
examples: Garden vegetables thrive in rich loam soil conditions
The valley's loam supports diverse agricultural crops

definitions: sum of money borrowed that is expected to be paid back with interest
temporary provision of an object or service to someone
examples: They took out a loan to purchase their first home
Student loans help finance higher education expenses
The museum received several paintings on loan from collectors
The library loan period extends for three weeks

definitions: act or process of lending money or objects to someone temporarily
examples: The bank specializes in loaning to small businesses
Loaning expensive equipment requires proper documentation

definitions: word adopted from one language and incorporated into another without translation
examples: 'Kindergarten' is a German loanword used in English
Japanese has many loanwords from English for technology terms

definitions: feeling of intense dislike, disgust, or hatred toward something or someone
examples: She felt deep loathing for dishonest business practices
His loathing of violence influenced his pacifist beliefs

definitions: ball thrown or hit in a high arc
tennis shot hit high over an opponent's head
examples: The goalkeeper's lob reached the opposite penalty area
He threw a perfect lob over the defender
Her defensive lob gave her time to recover position
The lob shot landed just inside the baseline

definitions: entrance hall or waiting area in a building, especially a hotel or theater
organized group seeking to influence politicians or public officials
organized attempt to influence legislators on a particular issue
examples: Hotel guests gathered in the spacious marble lobby
The theater lobby displayed posters of upcoming performances
The environmental lobby opposes the proposed pipeline
Industry lobbies contributed heavily to the campaign
Their lobby for education reform gained congressional support
The lobby against the tax increase intensified

definitions: person employed to influence legislators on behalf of a particular interest group
examples: Corporate lobbyists met with senators about the trade bill
The lobbyist represented pharmaceutical industry interests

definitions: rounded projecting part of an organ or structure
major division of the brain or lungs
soft lower part of the external ear
examples: The liver has four distinct lobes with different functions
Plant leaves may have multiple lobes along edges
The frontal lobe controls executive functions and personality
Lung lobes can be surgically removed if diseased
She wore diamond earrings in her pierced ear lobes
The ear lobe contains no cartilage structure

definitions: surgical operation involving incision into the frontal lobe of the brain, historically used to treat mental illness
examples: Lobotomies were controversially performed on psychiatric patients until the 1970s
The film depicted the devastating effects of forced lobotomy

definitions: large marine crustacean with muscular tail and large claws
meat from this crustacean prepared and served as food
examples: Lobsters turn red when cooked due to chemical changes
Maine lobsters are prized for their sweet meat
The restaurant serves lobster thermidor as their signature dish
Lobster rolls are popular along the New England coast

definitions: person who lives in a particular area or neighborhood
pub, shop, or other establishment serving a neighborhood
examples: Locals know the best restaurants away from tourist areas
The locals gathered to discuss community issues
We met at the local for drinks after work
The local serves traditional pub food daily

definitions: place where something happens or is set, especially in narrative or events
examples: The film uses exotic locales throughout Southeast Asia
The conference locale offers excellent facilities and accommodations

definitions: process of identifying or determining the position of something
process of adapting products or content for specific regional markets
examples: Brain localisation identifies which areas control specific functions
Sound localisation helps animals detect predator positions
Software localisation includes translating interfaces for different countries
Product localisation considers cultural preferences and regulations

definitions: feature, custom, or expression peculiar to a particular locality
preference for local political control rather than central government
examples: Regional localisms enrich the diversity of national culture
The dictionary includes localisms from various English dialects
Political localism advocates for community-level decision making
Localism empowers residents to shape their neighborhoods

definitions: particular area or neighborhood, especially as considered in reference to someone or something
position or site of something in relation to its surroundings
examples: Several schools serve this residential locality
The locality experienced rapid development over five years
The exact locality of the archaeological find remains confidential
Birds return to the same nesting locality annually

definitions: process of identifying or determining the position of something
process of adapting products or content for specific regional markets
examples: Tumor localization guides precise surgical intervention
GPS enables accurate localization of mobile devices
Game localization involves translating dialogue and cultural references
Website localization increases international user engagement

definitions: act or process of finding the exact position or place of something
examples: Locating underground pipes requires specialized detection equipment
The rescue team succeeded in locating the missing hikers

definitions: particular place or position where something exists or happens
actual place where a movie or television program is filmed
examples: The company chose a central location for their headquarters
GPS coordinates specify the exact location of landmarks
The director selected historic locations for period authenticity
Location shooting adds realism to the production

definitions: device or system used to find the position of something
code or system for identifying specific locations or resources
examples: The GPS locator tracked the vehicle's movements continuously
Emergency locator beacons help rescue teams find survivors
The library uses a book locator system for inventory
URL locators direct browsers to specific web resources

definitions: lake or narrow sea inlet in Scotland
examples: Loch Ness attracts tourists hoping to see the legendary monster
The Scottish Highlands contain numerous beautiful lochs

definitions: mechanical device for securing doors, containers, or other objects
section or curl of hair hanging together
enclosed water chamber in canals for raising or lowering boats
wrestling or martial arts hold that immobilizes an opponent
examples: The deadbolt lock provides additional security for exterior doors
She changed all locks after losing her keys
Her golden locks flowed down past her shoulders
The hairdresser trimmed a lock of damaged hair
Ships pass through locks to navigate different water levels
The canal lock system enables inland water transport
The wrestler applied an arm lock to force submission
Brazilian jiu-jitsu emphasizes joint locks and chokes

definitions: security measure confining people to a specific area during emergency
public movement restriction to prevent disease spread during health crisis
examples: The prison implemented immediate lockdown after the disturbance
Schools practice lockdown drills for emergency preparedness
The citywide lockdown lasted three months during the pandemic
Lockdown measures helped reduce virus transmission rates

definitions: small lockable cupboard or compartment for storing personal belongings
examples: Students store books in their assigned school lockers
Gym members rent lockers for valuables during workouts

definitions: small ornamental case worn on a necklace, typically containing a photograph or memento
examples: Her grandmother's locket contained tiny family photographs
The antique gold locket opened to reveal a miniature portrait

definitions: action or process of fastening something with a lock
mechanical process of parts fitting together to prevent movement
examples: Automatic locking ensures doors secure when closed
The locking mechanism prevents accidental opening
The differential locking improves traction on rough terrain
Proper locking of joints ensures structural stability

definitions: spasm of jaw muscles making it difficult to open the mouth, characteristic of tetanus
examples: Lockjaw prevents victims from eating or speaking normally
Tetanus vaccination prevents the development of lockjaw

definitions: employer's exclusion of workers from workplace during labor dispute
security feature preventing access after failed login attempts
examples: The factory lockout lasted six weeks before negotiations resumed
Management imposed a lockout after union strike threats
Account lockout protects against unauthorized access attempts
The system enforces automatic lockout after three failed passwords

definitions: person who makes and repairs locks and supplies keys as a profession
examples: The locksmith arrived quickly to help with the house lockout
An experienced locksmith can open most locks without damage

definitions: jail or place of temporary detention, especially in a police station
garage or storage facility that can be locked for security
examples: Suspects remained in the police lockup awaiting arraignment
The overnight lockup held those arrested during protests
They rent a lockup to store classic car collection
The lockup garage provides secure vehicle storage

definitions: movement or the ability to move from one place to another
examples: Bipedal locomotion distinguishes humans from most other mammals
Scientists study animal locomotion to design better robots

definitions: powered rail vehicle used for pulling trains along railway tracks
examples: The steam locomotive revolutionized transportation in the 1800s
Modern diesel locomotives can pull enormous freight loads

definitions: doctor or clergyman temporarily filling in for another who is absent
examples: The practice hired a locum while their doctor recovered
Locum positions offer flexibility for medical professionals

definitions: large grasshopper that migrates in vast swarms causing crop damage
tree with compound leaves and fragrant white flowers
examples: Locust swarms devastated crops across East Africa
A single locust swarm can contain billions of insects
The honey locust tree provides dappled shade in summer
Black locust wood resists rot naturally

definitions: vein of metal ore in the earth, especially one of value
examples: Miners discovered a rich gold lode in the mountain
The silver lode extended deep into the hillside

definitions: small house or cottage, especially one in a park or grounds
local branch or meeting place of a fraternal organization
room or dwelling for a gatekeeper or porter
examples: They rented a ski lodge for their winter vacation
The hunting lodge sits deep in the forest
The Masonic lodge meets monthly at their hall
Lodge members participate in charitable activities
The porter lives in the lodge by the main gate
Visitors check in at the entrance lodge

definitions: person who pays rent to live in someone's house with the owner
examples: The elderly widow takes in lodgers for extra income
University students often work as lodgers in family homes
